Key Match Events: The Minnesota Twins suffered a 7-2 loss to the Baltimore Orioles, marking the final nail in the coffin for their postseason hopes.
Pre-Game Insights: Carlos Correa criticized some players for not giving maximum effort, stating that being tired is not a valid excuse at this point.
Post-Match Reflections: Carlos Correa took the blame for the Twins' downturn due to his two-month absence from the team due to a foot injury.
Rocco Baldelli said the Twins' collapse 'will bother me forever' and that he will use it to motivate himself going forward.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Twins had a 5.5 game cushion for a wild card spot as recently as Sept. 5 but were overhauled by the Kansas City Royals and Detroit Tigers after an abysmal 12-25 run since early August.
Others: Carlos Correa will likely face scrutiny ahead of the 2025 season, but his defenders will point to a lack of support and investment from the Twins front office following last year's exciting playoff run.
